00055 CELTransformerEngine * CELTransformerEngine::FromBase(BaseEngine *engine)
00056 {
00057         if (engine != NULL && engine->getEngineName() == CELTransformerEngine::EngineName())
00058                 return (CELTransformerEngine *)engine;
00059         return NULL;
00060 }

00063 {
00064         defineOptions();
00065 }

00070 
00071 void CELTransformerEngine::defineOptions()
00072 {
00073         setUsage("apt-cel-transformer - Utility program for taking cel files and converting them\n"
00074                 "using a ChipStream path and saving the results to a modified set of cel files.\n"
00075                 "An example would include rma background subtracting and normalizing a set\n"
00076                 "of cel files that could then be used in another application without those\n"
00077                 "capabilities.\n"
00078                 "\n"
00079                 " *Warning* - If the output directory is the same as the input directory the\n"
00080                 "the original cel files will be overwritten with the transformed ones.\n"
00081                 "\n"
00082                 "A chipstream pathway is specified by a comma separated list of transformations\n"
00083                 "with specific parameters passed as key value pairs. For example:\n"
00084                 "rma-bg,quant-norm.usepm=true.sketch=50000 -> rma background subtract and then\n"
00085                 "                                             quantile normalize using only PM\n"
00086                 "                                             probes and a sketch size of 50K\n"
00087                 "rma-bg,med-norm -> rma background subtraction and then median normalization.\n"
00088                 "\n"
00089                 "usage:\n"
00090                 "   apt-cel-transformer -d chip.cdf -c rma-bg,quant-norm.sketch=50000 -o out-dir \\ \n"
00091                 "      celFile1.cel celFile2.cel ... celFileN.cel\n");
00092 
00093 
00094         defineOption("", "target-sketch", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00095                 "File specifying a target distribution to use for quantile normalization.",
00096                 "");
00097         defineOption("", "a5-target-sketch", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00098                 "File specifying an target distribution to use for quantile normalization in A5 format.",
00099                 "");
00100         defineOption("c", "chipstream", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00101                 "String representing tranformation desired. "
00102                 "For example: 'quant-norm.sketch=50000' does a quantile normalization using 50000 points.",
00103                 "");
00104         defineOption("", "probe-norm-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00105                 "File specifying index of probes (1 based) to use for normalization.",
00106                 "");
00107         defineOption("", "use-disk", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00108                 "Store CEL intensities to be analyzed on disk.", "true");
00109         defineOption("", "disk-cache", PgOpt::INT_OPT,
00110                 "Size of intensity memory cache in millions of intensities (when --use-disk=true).",
00111                 "50");
00112 
00113         defineOption("", "cel-files", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00114                 "Text file specifying cel files to process, one per line with the first line being 'cel_files'.",
00115                 "");
00116         defOptMult("", "cels", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00117         "Cel files to process.",
00118         "");
00119         defineOption("d", "cdf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00120                 "File defining probe sets",
00121                 "");
00122         defineOption("", "clf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00123                 "File defining probes",
00124                 "");
00125         defineOption("", "kill-list", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00126                 "File defining probes to remove",
00127                 "");
00128         defineOption("", "pgf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00129                 "File defining probe sets",
00130                 "");
00131         defineOption("", "spf-file", PgOpt::STRING_OPT,
00132                 "File defining probe sets",
00133                 "");
00134         defineOption("", "write-sketch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00135                 "Write the quantile normalization distribution (or sketch) "
00136                 "to a file in output-dir for reuse with target-sketch option.",
00137                 "false");
00138         defineOption("", "a5-write-sketch", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT,
00139                 "Write the quantile normalization distribution (or sketch) "
00140                 "to a file in output-dir for reuse with target-sketch option.",
00141                 "false");
00142         defineOption("", "update-header", PgOpt::BOOL_OPT, 
00143                 "Change guid and add apt-cel-transform meta info.", "true");
00144 }
00145 
00146 /** 
00147 * Figure out chip dimensions from the cel file specified.
00148 * 
00149 * @param fileName - Name of cel file to read header from.
00150 * @param numCols - Number of x columns.
00151 * @param numRows - Number of y rows.
00152 */
00153 static void getDimensions(string fileName, colrow_t& numCols, colrow_t& numRows) {
00154         FusionCELData cel;
00155         cel.SetFileName(fileName.c_str());
00156         if (!cel.ReadHeader()) 
00157                 Err::errAbort("Can't read cel file: " + cel.GetFileName());
00158         numCols = cel.GetCols();
00159         numRows = cel.GetRows();
00160         cel.Close();
00161 }
00162 
00163 /**
00164 * Transform AGCC CEL Files
00165 */
00166 void CELTransformerEngine::transformNew(int celIx, vector<ChipStream *> &cStreamVec) {
00167 
00168         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00169         string outCelFileName = Fs::join(outDir , Fs::basename(celFiles[celIx]));
00170         vector<string> tmpFileNames;
00171         GlobalTmpFileFactory()->setTmpdir(outDir);
00172 
00173         try {
00174                 // read agcc cel file
00175                 affymetrix_calvin_io::CelFileReader reader;
00176                 reader.SetFilename(celFiles[celIx]);
00177                 affymetrix_calvin_io::CelFileData cel;
00178                 reader.Read(cel);
00179                 int numCells;
00180                 WStringVector channelVec = cel.GetChannels();
00181                 for (int channelIx = 0; channelIx < channelVec.size(); ++channelIx) {
00182                         cel.SetActiveChannel(channelVec[channelIx]);
00183                         numCells = cel.GetNumCells();
00184                         vector<float> intensities;
00185                         if (!cel.GetIntensities(0,numCells,intensities))
00186                                 Err::errAbort("Unable to retrieve intensities for " + celFiles[celIx]);
00187                         vector<float> stdev;
00188                         if (!cel.GetStdev(0,numCells,stdev))
00189                                 Err::errAbort("Unable to retrieve stdev for " + celFiles[celIx]);
00190                         vector<int16_t>  npixels;
00191                         if (!cel.GetNumPixels(0,numCells,npixels))
00192                                 Err::errAbort("Unable to retrieve num pixels for " + celFiles[celIx]);
00193                         vector<XYCoord> outliers;
00194                         cel.GetOutlierCoords(outliers);
00195 
00196                         vector<XYCoord> masked;
00197                         cel.GetMaskedCoords(masked);
00198 
00199                         string workingCelFileName = outCelFileName;
00200                         // if multi-channel Cel, then temp single-channel Cels have to be
00201                         // written and then collated later
00202                         if (channelVec.size() > 1) {
00203                                 // make temporary output CEL file
00204                                 workingCelFileName = GlobalTmpFileFactory()->genFilename(StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(channelVec[channelIx]) + ".", ".cel");
00205                                 tmpFileNames.push_back(workingCelFileName);
00206                         }
00207 
00208                         affymetrix_calvin_io::CelFileData outCel(workingCelFileName);
00209 
00210                         affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericDataHeader *inHdr = cel.GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr();
00211                         affymetrix_calvin_io::GenericDataHeader *outHdr = outCel.GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr();
00212                         ParameterNameValueType param;
00213                         int headerCount = inHdr->GetNameValParamCnt();
00214                         for (int hdrIx = 0; hdrIx < headerCount; ++hdrIx) {
00215                                 param = inHdr->GetNameValParam(hdrIx);
00216                                 outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00217                         }
00218                         affymetrix_calvin_io::GenDataHdrVectorIt begin, end;
00219                         inHdr->GetParentIterators(begin, end);
00220                         while (begin != end) {
00221                                 // this snippet of commented code was useful for generating
00222                                 // test data.  it writes the temporary single-channel CELs as
00223                                 // proper CEL files that do not require the CelReader HACK.
00224                                 // (hard-coded adjustment of the number of channels in a
00225                                 // single-channel CEL that was derived from a multi-channel
00226                                 // CEL).  as the code stands, if this snippet were uncommented
00227                                 // this tool would break.  the code is left here for now as a
00228                                 // reference to how I made the test data.
00229                                 //                 if (begin->FindNameValParam(AFFY_WAVELENGTH, param)) {
00230                                 //                     param.SetValueText(channelVec[channelIx]);
00231                                 //                     begin->AddNameValParam(param);
00232                                 //                 }
00233                                 outHdr->AddParent(*begin);
00234                                 begin++;
00235                         }    
00236 
00237                         // add wavelength info if this is multichannel -- the
00238                         // collator uses this field to name the data groups
00239                         if (channelVec.size() > 1) {
00240                                 param.SetName(AFFY_FILTER_WAVELENGTH);
00241                                 param.SetValueText(channelVec[channelIx]);
00242                                 outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00243                         }
00244 
00245                         if (getOptBool("update-header") == true) {
00246                                 // change guid and store old one in header
00247                                 affymetrix_calvin_utilities::AffymetrixGuidType oldGuid = inHdr->GetFileId();
00248                                 param.SetName(L"affymetrix-previous-guid");
00249                                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(oldGuid));
00250                                 outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00251                                 // store command-line in new CEL header
00252                                 param.SetName(L"affymetrix-algorithm-param-command-line");
00253                                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(commandLine()));
00254                                 outHdr->AddNameValParam(param);
00255                         }
00256 
00257                         outCel.SetIntensityCount(intensities.size());
00258                         outCel.SetStdDevCount(stdev.size());
00259                         outCel.SetPixelCount(npixels.size());
00260                         outCel.SetOutlierCount(outliers.size());
00261                         outCel.SetMaskCount(masked.size());
00262 
00263                         //  writer
00264                         affymetrix_calvin_io::CelFileWriter writer(outCel);
00265                         // get and transform intensities.
00266                         for (int featIx = 0; featIx < numCells; featIx++) {
00267                                 intensities[featIx] = (*cStreamVec[cStreamVec.size() - 1]).getTransformedIntensity(featIx, celIx, channelIx);
00268                         }
00269 
00270                         // write out new intensity values
00271                         writer.WriteIntensities(intensities);
00272 
00273                         // copy over other parts
00274                         writer.WriteStdDevs(stdev);
00275                         writer.WritePixels(npixels);
00276                         if (outliers.size() > 0) {
00277                                 writer.WriteOutlierCoords(outliers);
00278                         }
00279                         if (masked.size() > 0) {
00280                                 writer.WriteMaskCoords(masked);
00281                         }
00282                 }
00283 
00284                 if (channelVec.size() > 1) {
00285                         affymetrix_calvin_io::MultiChannelCelFileCollater collator;
00286                         collator.Collate(tmpFileNames, outCelFileName);
00287                         { for( int i=0; i < tmpFileNames.size();  i++ ) { Fs::rm(tmpFileNames[i]);} } ;
00288                 }
00289         }
00290         catch(Except &e) {
00291                 Err::errAbort(e.what());
00292         }
00293         catch(const std::bad_alloc &e) {
00294                 { for( int i=0; i < tmpFileNames.size();  i++ ) { Fs::rm(tmpFileNames[i], false);} } ;
00295                 Err::errAbort("Ran out of memory. "
00296                         "Try quitting other applications.");
00297         }
00298         catch(CalvinException &ce) {
00299                 { for( int i=0; i < tmpFileNames.size();  i++ ) { Fs::rm(tmpFileNames[i], false);} } ;
00300                 Err::errAbort("Affymetrix GeneChip Command Console library has thrown an exception. "
00301                         "Description: '" +StringUtils::ConvertWCSToMBS(ce.Description()) + "'");
00302         }
00303         catch(const std::exception &e) {
00304                 Err::errAbort("Exception caught. "
00305                         "Most problems with this program are memory related. "
00306                         "Message is: " + ToStr(e.what()));
00307         }
00308         catch(const BaseException &e) {
00309                 Err::errAbort("newmat issue: " + ToStr(e.what()));
00310         }
00311         catch(...) {
00312                 Err::errAbort("Unknown exception caught "
00313                         "(most problems with this program are memory related).");
00314         }
00315 }
00316 
00317 /**
00318 * Transform old-style CEL files (text, xda)
00319 */
00320 void CELTransformerEngine::transformOld(int celIx, vector<ChipStream *> &cStreamVec) {
00321         affxcel::CCELFileWriter celWriterOld;
00322         celWriterOld.SetFileName(celFiles[celIx].c_str());
00323         if (!celWriterOld.Read()) 
00324                 Err::errAbort("Can't read cel file: " + celWriterOld.GetFileName());
00325 
00326         string format = "unknown";
00327         if (celWriterOld.IsXDACompatibleFile())
00328                 format = "xda";
00329         else if (celWriterOld.IsTranscriptomeBcelFile())
00330                 format = "bcel";
00331         else if (celWriterOld.IsCompactCelFile())
00332                 format = "ccel";
00333         else if (celWriterOld.IsVersion3CompatibleFile())
00334                 format = "text";
00335 
00336         // the celfile might be mapped read-only -- make it writeable
00337         celWriterOld.EnsureNotMmapped();
00338         int numCells = celWriterOld.GetNumCells();
00339         for (int featIx = 0; featIx < numCells; featIx++) {
00340                 float intensity = (*cStreamVec[cStreamVec.size() - 1]).getTransformedIntensity(featIx, celIx);
00341                 celWriterOld.SetIntensity(featIx, intensity);
00342         }
00343         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00344         string outCel = Fs::join(outDir , Fs::basename(celWriterOld.GetFileName()));
00345         celWriterOld.SetFileName(outCel.c_str());
00346 
00347         bool success = false;
00348         if (format == "text") 
00349                 success = celWriterOld.WriteTextCel();
00350         else if (format == "xda")
00351                 success = celWriterOld.WriteXDABCel();
00352         else if (format == "bcel")
00353                 success = celWriterOld.WriteTranscriptomeBCel();
00354         else if (format == "ccel") 
00355                 success = celWriterOld.WriteCompactBCel();
00356         else 
00357                 Err::errAbort("Don't recognize type: " + string(format));
00358 
00359         if (!success)
00360                 Err::errAbort("could not save file: " + outCel);
00361         celWriterOld.Close();
00362 }
00363 
00364 /** 
00365 * Transform all of the cel files specified using the chipstream modification stream
00366 * specified by the chipStreamStr and save the new modified cel files in the output directory.
00367 */
00368 void CELTransformerEngine::runImp() {
00369         /* get basic layout info */
00370         colrow_t numCols, numRows;
00371         int probeCount, psCount;
00372         vector<string> chipTypes;
00373 
00374         bool force = getOptBool("force");
00375         string cdfFile = getOpt("cdf-file");
00376     string clfFile = getOpt("clf-file");
00377     string pgfFile = getOpt("pgf-file");
00378     string spfFile = getOpt("spf-file");
00379 
00380         if (cdfFile != "") {
00381                 EngineUtil::getCdfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, psCount, cdfFile);
00382                 if (!force)
00383                         EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypes, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00384         }
00385         else if (pgfFile != "") {
00386                 EngineUtil::getPgfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, pgfFile, clfFile);
00387                 if (!force)
00388                         EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypes, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00389         }
00390         else if (spfFile != "") {
00391                 EngineUtil::getSpfChipType(chipTypes, numRows, numCols, probeCount, psCount, spfFile);
00392                 if (!force)
00393                         EngineUtil::checkCelChipTypes(chipTypes, probeCount, celFiles, numRows, numCols);
00394         }
00395         else {
00396                 getDimensions(celFiles[0], numCols, numRows);
00397                 probeCount = numCols * numRows;
00398         }
00399 
00400         /* Get the layout for the chip. */
00401         // Specifies probesets, locations of features on chip.
00402         ChipLayout layout; 
00403         // empty list of probesets, ie we want to load all
00404         std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> probeSetsToLoad; 
00405         // empty list, ie load everything
00406         std::vector<bool> probeSubset; 
00407         // we have already check chip type, so use empty string;
00408         string chipType; 
00409         //
00410         probeidmap_t killList;
00411 
00412         if (cdfFile != "") {
00413                 Verbose::out(1, "Opening cdf file: " + Fs::basename(cdfFile));
00414                 if (!layout.openCdf(cdfFile, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, killList, false)) 
00415                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open cdf file: " + cdfFile);
00416         }
00417         else if (pgfFile != "") {
00418                 affx::ClfFile clf;
00419 
00420                 /* open clf file. */
00421                 if (clfFile=="") 
00422                         Err::errAbort("Must specify a clf file for chip.");
00423                 Verbose::out(1, "Opening clf file: " +  Fs::basename(clfFile));
00424                 if (!clf.open(clfFile))
00425                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open clf file: " + clfFile);
00426                 layout.setDimensions(clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1);
00427 
00428                 /* Make sure our assumptions about CLF file are true */
00429                 Err::check(clf.getSequential() == 1,
00430                         "ProbesetSummarizeEngine::loadPgfLayout() - unable to handle clf file without sequential set to 1.");
00431                 Err::check(clf.getOrder().compare("col_major") == 0 || clf.getOrder().compare("row_major") == 0,
00432                         "Unable to handle clf file without order set to row_major (old mislabeled 'col_major' accepted due to earlier bug.)");
00433 
00434                 /* open pgf */
00435                 Verbose::out(1, "Opening pgf file: " + Fs::basename(pgfFile));
00436                 if (!layout.openPgf(pgfFile, clf.getXMax() + 1, clf.getYMax() + 1, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, killList, false, false))
00437                         Err::errAbort("Couldn't open PGF file: " + pgfFile);
00438         }
00439         else if (spfFile != "") {
00440                 std::set<affxcdf::GeneChipProbeSetType> psTypesToLoad;
00441                 Verbose::out(1, "Opening spf file: " + Fs::basename(cdfFile));
00442                 layout.openSpf(spfFile, probeSetsToLoad, NULL, probeSubset, chipType, false, psTypesToLoad);
00443         }
00444         else {
00445                 Verbose::out(1,"Setting layout dimensions from cel file. Assuming all probes are PM.");
00446                 layout.setDimensions(numCols, numRows);
00447                 vector<bool> mask(layout.getProbeCount(), true);
00448                 layout.setPmProbeMask(mask);
00449         }
00450 
00451         /* get list of probes to kill */
00452         /* we do this after the chip layout load as we don't want these to drop on the floor */
00453         string killListFile = getOpt("kill-list");
00454         if (killListFile != "")
00455                 ChipLayout::fillInKillList(killListFile, killList, numRows, numCols);
00456 
00457         /* Setup chipstream factory */
00458         ChipStreamFactory cFactory;
00459 
00460         string targetSketch = getOpt("target-sketch");
00461         string probeNormFile = getOpt("probe-norm-file");
00462         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00463         if (targetSketch != "") 
00464                 cFactory.readTargetSketchFromFile(targetSketch);
00465         if (getOptBool("write-sketch") == true) 
00466                 cFactory.setWriteSketchDir(outDir + Fs::osPathSep());
00467         if (getOptBool("a5-write-sketch") == true) 
00468                 cFactory.setWriteSketchDir_a5(outDir + Fs::osPathSep());
00469         if (probeNormFile != "")
00470                 cFactory.readNormProbesFromFile(probeNormFile);
00471         if (killListFile != "") {
00472                 /// @todo allow provision of kill list to Chipstream Factor
00473                 ///cFactory.setKillList(killList);
00474                 Err::errAbort("Kill list not yet implemented. Try probe-norm-file instead.");
00475         }
00476 
00477         /* Create our chipstream objects. */
00478         std::string chipStreamStr = getOpt("chipstream");
00479         ChipStream *cStream = NULL;      // Our chipstream for transforming data.
00480         vector<ChipStream *> cStreamVec;
00481         vector<string> words;
00482 
00483         Util::chopString(chipStreamStr, ',', words);
00484         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < words.size(); i++) {
00485                 string dummy;
00486                 cStream = cFactory.chipStreamForString(words[i], layout, dummy );
00487                 if (!cStreamVec.empty()) {
00488                         cStreamVec[cStreamVec.size() - 1]->registerStream(cStream);
00489                         cStream->registerParent(cStreamVec[cStreamVec.size() - 1]);
00490                 }
00491                 cStreamVec.push_back(cStream);
00492         }
00493 
00494         /* Create intensity mart */
00495         std::vector<int> dummy_order(probeCount);
00496         for (int i = 0; i < probeCount; i++) {
00497                 dummy_order[i] = i;
00498         }
00499 
00500         IntensityMart* iMart = NULL;
00501         bool useDisk = getOptBool("use-disk");
00502         if (useDisk) {
00503                 int cacheSize = getOptInt("disk-cache");
00504                 string tempDir = getOpt("temp-dir");
00505                 DiskIntensityMart* diskMart = new DiskIntensityMart(dummy_order,
00506                         celFiles, 
00507                         cacheSize * 1048576, 
00508                         tempDir, 
00509                         "apt-transform.tmp.", 
00510                         true);
00511                 iMart = diskMart;
00512         }
00513         else {
00514                 SparseMart* sparseMart = new SparseMart(dummy_order,celFiles,true);
00515                 iMart = sparseMart;
00516         }
00517 
00518         /* set cel files */
00519         CelReader cReader;               // Object for getting data from cel files.
00520 
00521         cReader.setFiles(celFiles);
00522 
00523         /* Let reader know to pass data to our chipstream object. */
00524         cReader.registerStream(cStreamVec[0]);
00525         cReader.registerIntensityMart(iMart);
00526         Verbose::out(1,"Reading cel files.");
00527 
00528         /* Open, read, and send cel file data one by one to chipstream. */
00529         cReader.readFiles();
00530 
00531         /* Transform the data and write it out. */
00532         unsigned int dotMod = max((int)celFiles.size()/20, 1);
00533         Verbose::progressBegin(1, "Adjusting and writing files", 20, (int)dotMod, (int)celFiles.size());
00534 
00535         for (int i = 0; i < celFiles.size(); i++) {
00536                 Verbose::progressStep(1);
00537                 if (affymetrix_cel_converter::CELFileVersion::DetermineCELFileVersion(celFiles[i].c_str())==affymetrix_cel_converter::Calvin_Version1)
00538                         transformNew(i,cStreamVec);
00539                 else
00540                         transformOld(i,cStreamVec);
00541         }
00542 
00543         delete cStream;
00544 
00545         Freez(iMart);
00546 
00547         /* Remove the temp dir if it is empty */
00548         string tempDir = getOpt("temp-dir");
00549         if (Fs::isWriteableDir(tempDir))
00550                 Fs::rmdir(tempDir,false);
00551 
00552         Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done.");
00553 }
00554 
00555 void CELTransformerEngine::checkOptionsImp()
00556 {
00557         EngineUtil::getCelFiles(celFiles, this);
00558         
00559         /* Sanity checks... */
00560         if (getOpt("chipstream") == "") 
00561                 Err::errAbort("Must specify a chipstream transformer.");
00562         if (getOpt("out-dir") == "") 
00563                 Err::errAbort("Must specify an output directory.");
00564         if (getOpt("probe-norm-file") != "" && getOpt("kill-list") != "") 
00565                 Err::errAbort("Cannot provide a kill list and a probe norm list.");
00566         if (celFiles.empty()) 
00567                 Err::errAbort("Must specify at least one cel file to open.");
00568 
00569         /* Make our directory. */
00570         string outDir = getOpt("out-dir");
00571         Util::chompLastIfSep(outDir);
00572         setOpt("out-dir", outDir);
00573         if (!Fs::isWriteableDir(outDir)) {
00574                 if (Fs::mkdirPath(outDir, false) != APT_OK) {
00575                         APT_ERR_ABORT("Can't make or write to directory: " + outDir);
00576                 }
00577         }
00578 
00579         string tempDir = getOpt("temp-dir");
00580         if (tempDir == "") {
00581                 tempDir = Fs::join(outDir,"temp"); 
00582                 setOpt("temp-dir", tempDir);
00583         }
00584 }
